data.title: Test Large Project Warning Improvements
data.body:
#15208 

- [x] Windows @mousetraps 
- [x] macOS @chrmarti 
- [x] Linux @rebornix 

Complexity: 2

**Does not show up for a basic project**

1. `git clone https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-textmate.git`
1. `cd vscode-textmate`
1. `npm install`
1. Open folder in vscode and wait a moment.
   - [ ] Check the status bar. There should not be any message about configure excludes.

**Shows up for a large project**

1. Create  a blank js/node project with a few empty js files in it.
2. Copy all the contents of the `node_modules` folder from vscode into a directory called `js` inside the new project (We just want to create a bunch of js files in the project).
3. Open folder in VSCode and wait 30 seconds or so
   - [ ] Implicit project, so there should still be no `configure excludes` message
4. Create an `jsconfig.json` with the content `{}`  and reload the workspace. Wait another 30 seconds or so:
   - [ ] There should be a message about configure excludes in the status bar

       ![screen shot 2016-12-05 at 11 23 50 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/20899273/a9278960-bade-11e6-8b34-377cc5ed723a.png)

5. Click on `configure excludes`.
    - [ ] You should see this pop up:

      ![screen shot 2016-12-05 at 11 35 12 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/20899349/e8bcf15a-bade-11e6-9966-a7c498283e1f.png)

6. Click on this popup.
    - [ ] It should open your `jsconfig.json` file

data.title: Make it easier to resize panes without having to click on sashes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

This is a feature request:
On Ubuntu, you can easily resize any window by holding down alt, center click the mouse and drag. The window resize based on which of the corners or sides is closest. (You can test the functionality in windows with AltDrag). This makes resizing windows SO fast, you don't have to "aim" for a precise edge of the window, you just go very approximately and it will resize like you want. This is a huge help when you want to have multiple windows open on a single page. 

So, the feature I would like to have is to be able to resize the panes more quickly than I can now. When I'm working with 2 or especially 3 panes opened, I find myself resizing the panes often. I want to see more of the code I'm working on currently, but I like to keep the other panes there for the references to functions/tests/etc I'm calling. When I'm finished working on that file, I resize the panes and start working in another pane. If I could hold alt, center click my mouse close to a pane edge to resize the panes, (or something similar) it would save me a lot of time. 

Thanks!

data.title: Incorrect Syntax Highlighting in VS Dark+ For Computed JS Object Property Name
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8 Insiders

From #16469

**Steps to Reproduce:**

Use VS Dark+ or VS Light+ themes with js code:

```js
({})[1 + 'x']

const a = {
    [1 + 'x']: '3'
}


```

**Expected**
Colorization of computed member is similar to the normal accessor.

**Actual**

![screen shot 2016-12-05 at 10 58 51 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/20898076/cd8b214a-bad9-11e6-9641-230e2142fedf.png)

This case is correctly colored using most other themes including non-plus VS Dark and VS Light:

![screen shot 2016-12-05 at 11 00 20 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/20898120/0153b0be-bada-11e6-9d91-ad6e98cb6adf.png)

data.title: Test Configuration Settings #15162
data.body:
Test for #15162
- [ ] Windows @ramya-rao-a
- [x] macOS @chrmarti
- [x] Linux @tyriar

Complexity: 4

Open User settings or workspace settings and try following

- Check that settings are properly grouped. First group is always Most commonly used followed by others.
- Navigate (expand/collapse) groups and see the settings
- Default settings and Settings file are shown side by side in single editor. Closing the editor closes both.
- Change the Settings of the editor which can impact Default settings editor and make sure it is not impacted and shown properly. For eg., change font size and see how default settings editor is shown. Similarly change other editor specific settings like indentation etc.
- Repeat the same by opening Workspace settings
- Play around by placing them in same group and in different groups.
- Also try to copy/paste settings from left to right and test that settings are applied

---

- Use the Search box to find a setting. You can search for content in setting description, key, value. 
- Test that settings are filtered as expected. Settings with no matches in descriptions, key, value are not shown.
- Use key `Enter` to navigate through filtered settings
- Check that count is shown correctly
- Pressing `Ctrl+F` or `Cmd+F` in Default Settings Editor focuses the search box

---

- In Default settings editor, Hovering on a setting shows a copy action icon
- Clicking on it will either
    a. Copy the setting into the editor on the side, if the setting is not of enum or boolean type
    b. Shows context menu to select a value, if the setting is of enum or boolean type. On selecting the value copies the setting with selected value to the side.
- Above action is also available in the Editable Settings editor on the right only for boolean or enum settings. Clicking on them and selecting the value changes the value for the setting.

data.title: Test: Javascript and CSS in HTML
data.body:
Test for #15377:

- [x] Windows - **@isidorn**
- [x] OS X - **@joaomoreno**
- [x] Linux - **@sandy081**

Complexity: 4

Test HTML files with JavaScript content:
- Content inside script tags, with an with/without type='application/javascript' and 'text/javascript'
- Content inside event handlers `onClick="alert('hello!')"`
- Test Validation, Hovers, Code Complete, Signature Help, Symbol highlighting, References, Definitions, Document symbols (Ctrl+Shift+O)
- Test code completion agains the DOM API as well as JQuery API (always available)
- Note that script includes are not taken into account, nor are other JavaScript files in the workspace. Only scripts in the current HTML file are looked at.

Test HTML files with CSS content:
- Content inside style tags
- Content inside 'style' attributes `<div style='color:red'>`
- Test Validation, Hovers, Code Complete, Symbol highlighting, Document symbols (Ctrl+Shift+O), Color decorators

Format, full document and range
- note that there's no built-in css formatter
- note that the html formatter has configuration settings that specify which tags not to be formatted

data.title: Is it possible to install mutliple language servers into one extension?
data.body:
See Question above.

I created my first language server using the tutorial from the vscode documentation. It runs just great. Now I wanted to create another one, which should run in the same client, but I always get error messages:

> ui5manifest-language-server@0.0.1 watch c:\Users\pazureck\openui5VsCodeExtension\ui5manifestjsonserver
> installServerIntoExtension ../client ./package.json ./tsconfig.json && tsc --watch -p .
outDir in ./tsconfig.json must point to c:\Users\pazureck\openui5VsCodeExtension\client\server but it points to c:\Users\pazureck\openui5VsCodeExtension\client\servers\manifestserver
Please change outDir in ./tsconfig.json to ../client/server
npm ERR! Windows_NT 10.0.14393
npm ERR! argv "C:\\Program Files (x86)\\nodejs\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files (x86)\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "run" "watch"
npm ERR! node v6.9.1
npm ERR! npm  v3.10.8
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! ui5manifest-language-server@0.0.1 watch: `installServerIntoExtension ../client ./package.json ./tsconfig.json && tsc --watch -p .`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the ui5manifest-language-server@0.0.1 watch script 'installServerIntoExtension ../client ./package.json ./tsconfig.json && tsc --watch -p .'.
npm ERR! Make sure you have the latest version of node.js and npm installed.
npm ERR! If you do, this is most likely a problem with the ui5manifest-language-server package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
npm ERR! Tell the author that this fails on your system:
npm ERR!     installServerIntoExtension ../client ./package.json ./tsconfig.json && tsc --watch -p .
npm ERR! You can get information on how to open an issue for this project with:
npm ERR!     npm bugs ui5manifest-language-server
npm ERR! Or if that isn't available, you can get their info via:
npm ERR!     npm owner ls ui5manifest-language-server
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.
npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!     c:\Users\pazureck\openui5VsCodeExtension\ui5manifestjsonserver\npm-debug.log
Watching build tasks has finished.

Is it generally possible to install 2 language servers, or should each language server have its own client(s).

data.title: Broken non-alphabetical shortcuts with non-US keyboards
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Instead of accepting non-alphabetical keys positions for keyboard shortcuts bindings, application only accepts original keys positions on US keyboard layout.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Consider brazilian portuguese ABNT 2 keyboard layout, more specifically the position of <kbd>[</kbd> and <kbd>]</kbd> keys:
![brazilian portuguese ABNT 2 keyboard layout](http://s2.glbimg.com/hlQMZ_E87B3DB_96rVuO_pY2Yy8=/695x0/s.glbimg.com/po/tt2/f/original/2016/06/21/900px-kb_portuguese_brazilsvg_.png)
2. Trying to use code folding shortcut <kbd>Ctrl+[</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl+]</kbd> doesn't work, but rather <kbd>Ctrl+´</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl+[</kbd>, which are the original keys position on US layout.

data.title: ASP.NET Core Project templates- Feature Request
data.body: If ASP.NET Core Project templates are introduced in VSCODE it will be great.

data.title: Cmd-d of single character followed by typing same character as has no effect
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2

This is a odd one. Steps to reproduce:

1. Create document `x x`.
2. Hit cmd-D twice to select both.
3. Type `x`.
4. _Nothing will happen_.
5. Type `y`.
6. All instances will be replaced by `y`.

What I expected would happen: All instances should be replaced with `x` and the cursor moved after it, so that when you then type `y`, you end up with `xy xy`.

If it sounds minor, this happens to me all the time. For example, when replacing one-letter loop variables.

data.title: VSCode-tslint: tslint 4.0 support
data.body:
Complexity: 2

- [x] any OS @weinand 

vscode-tslint now supports tslint > 4.0 (see the tslint 4.0 [blog](https://palantir.github.io/tslint/2016/11/17/new-for-4.0.html). 

## Setup
Install the latest vscode-tslint (version 0.7.1). Notice that tslint has a peer dependency on TypeScript and either install tslint and typescript both globally or locally.

## Test
- test that vscode-tslint still works with tslint versions < 4, e.g., 3.17.
- test that the quick fixes that come with tslint 4.0 are properly applied (see the blog for available quick fixes).
- for a set of tslint rules vscode-tslint provides quick fixes independent of tslint:  `comment-format`, 
`triple-equals`, `whitespace`, `quotemark`. Check that this fixes work when using tslint 4.0 or tslint < 4.0.
- for all warnings there is a special quick fix to disable the rule for the next line.
- test the bulk quick fixes showing in the light bulb, to fix all warnings of the same type and all autofixable problems.

A set of manual tests for the quick fixes can be found here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-tslint/tree/master/tslint-tests.

data.title: TypeError: Cannot read property 'fillInContext' of undefined
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. very quickly jump between a normal editor and the (new) settings editor

=>

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'fillInContext' of undefined
    at ScopedContextKeyService.AbstractContextKeyService.contextMatchesRules (contextKeyService.js:154)
    at Menu.getActions (menuService.js:93)
    at Object.fillInActions (menuItemActionItem.js:22)
    at TabsTitleControl.TitleControl.getEditorActions (titleControl.js:215)
    at TabsTitleControl.TitleControl.updateEditorActionsToolbar (titleControl.js:248)
    at TabsTitleControl.doUpdate (tabsTitleControl.js:171)
    at TabsTitleControl.TitleControl.onSchedule (titleControl.js:85)
    at RunOnceScheduler.runner (titleControl.js:37)
    at RunOnceScheduler.onTimeout (async.js:569)
```

Everytime the settings editor is activated, new editors (for left and right hand side) are being created, this might have an impact on the issue.

/cc @jrieken

data.title: Middle-click Scrolling

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
New feature suggestion: Middle mouse click scrolling

This is another feature that is supported by Visual Studio and Edge that would be useful in VSCode.

When the middle mouse click is pressed, it toggles the cursor to a quad-directional arrow.  Once that is toggled, moving the mouse in relation to where the mouse was when toggled, will scroll the page in the corresponding direction.

data.title: Issue with files.autoSave set to onFocusChange

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.8.0-insider
Commit c032f0e2bc602eb9388221876911913e5a808aec
Date 2016-12-05T07:04:32.572Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set "files.autoSave": "onFocusChange" in settings.json
2. Change the file content & press ctrl+s, you will see the following message continuously (really fast, sometime you might not see because the editor goes crazy & tries to show the message in a loop as showing the message itself triggers focus change) & the file does not get saved.

Screenshot attached.
![issue with vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/452518/20890655/a1a74b18-bb2d-11e6-885c-19e39f9e87bd.png)

```
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
	"editor.fontFamily": "Hack",
	"editor.fontSize": 16,
	"editor.renderWhitespace": "boundary",
	"editor.renderIndentGuides": true,
	"files.autoSave": "afterDelay",
	"editor.renderLineHighlight": "gutter",
	"telemetry.enableTelemetry": false,

}
```
